title: INVENTORY / RUBY'S JOURNAL
description: Here you can learn about Ruby's involvement with La Puta Madre.

dialogueTree.title: Ruby's Journal: "The thick journal bound in brown le..."
dialogueTree.text: The thick journal bound in brown leather is full of candour and diagrams.

links.title: You: "Study the handwriting."
links.text: Study the handwriting.

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "The large cursive of someone who wr..."
links.text: The large cursive of someone who writes quickly and confidently.

links.title: Interfacing: "Perhaps too confidently -- many phr..."
links.text: Perhaps too confidently -- many phrases and even paragraphs have been crossed out, with tiny corrections scrawled above and in the margins.

links.title: You: "Flip through the pages again."
links.text: Flip through the pages again.

links.title: You: "What kinds of logistics?"
links.text: What kinds of logistics?

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "Hard to tell exactly -- it's mostly..."
links.text: Hard to tell exactly -- it's mostly noted down in code. Looks like contact information, quantities, directions.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There could be useful information..."
links.text: "There could be useful information about local operations in those notes. We have a junior sergeant at my station who's good with codes -- I can give this to her after we finish this."

links.title: Volition: "Professionalism is his coping mecha..."
links.text: Professionalism is his coping mechanism.

links.title: You: "What are the diagrams of?"
links.text: What are the diagrams of?

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "Esoteric radio technology. The most..."
links.text: Esoteric radio technology. The most recent ones probably pertain to the Latitude Compressor: sketches, calculations of distance and density. You make out a familiar spiral shape.

links.title: You: "Anything personal?"
links.text: Anything personal?

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "Short, wry observations of people a..."
links.text: Short, wry observations of people and places -- probably a way to pass the time on the road. Also, what appear to be attempts to sort through some difficult decisions. There are a few passages with many questions in them.

links.title: Interfacing: "The way some of those question mark..."
links.text: The way some of those question marks trail off into ellipses -- she was going through a tough time.

links.title: Authority: "Staff issues, always tough on the l..."
links.text: Staff issues, always tough on the leadership. You smell traces of betrayal.

links.title: You: "How far back do the entries go?"
links.text: How far back do the entries go?

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "The first entry is from August 2nd..."
links.text: The first entry is from August 2nd of last year. It reads simply: "I know my position is precarious. All I can do is make myself as useful as I can while looking for a way out. (Remember: no one is indispensable.)"

links.title: You: "What did she write the day Lely die..."
links.text: What did she write the day Lely died?

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "Nothing on March 4th... March 5th,..."
links.text: Nothing on March 4th... March 5th, though: "Well, *that's* bound to come back and bite me in the ass. I'm bad at this -- loyal to a fault. Except... But that's another matter entirely."

links.title: Logic: "She is referring to betraying her p..."
links.text: She is referring to betraying her previous employer. Does this suggest she did it in self-defence?

links.title: Logic: "You have no idea what she means. Th..."
links.text: You have no idea what she means. These are personal notes, don't expect to understand all of it.

links.title: You: "Anything about... La Puta Madre?"
links.text: Anything about... La Puta Madre?

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "That name isn't mentioned as far as..."
links.text: That name isn't mentioned as far as you can tell.

links.title: Logic: "Small wonder -- would you talk abou..."
links.text: Small wonder -- would you talk about La Puta Madre in your journal? You do see an 'M' though -- La Puta Madre? 'M' is mentioned on March 9th and March 15th.

links.title: You: "Read the entry from March 9th first..."
links.text: Read the entry from March 9th first.

links.title: Ruby's Journal: ""Great. M's peone is coming to town..."
links.text: "Great. M's peone is coming to town, no doubt to investigate the lynching, but also -- I feel it in my gut -- to finally put a bullet in my head. While I'm napping in my lorry or on a smoke break... Well, I won't stick around just to twist my own neck by constantly looking over my shoulder."

links.title: Ruby's Journal: ""Then again, isn't that what I've b..."
links.text: "Then again, isn't that what I've been doing ever since I got the call."

links.title: Reaction Speed: ""The call"? Did M call her personal..."
links.text: "The call"? Did M call her personally? Why?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Things played out just as she had f..."
links.text: Things played out just as she had feared. Except *you* didn't shoot her.

links.title: Half Light: "It's in you to do something like th..."
links.text: It's in you to do something like this -- kill her. Physically at least. You could pull the trigger if you had to.

links.title: You: "No, I couldn't."
links.text: No, I couldn't.

links.title: Half Light: "Yes, you could. You'd pull it one,..."
links.text: Yes, you could. You'd pull it one, two, three times -- and watch her fall.

links.title: Empathy: "No, stop... He wouldn't do that."
links.text: No, stop... He wouldn't do that.

links.title: You: "This is not me. I wouldn't do somet..."
links.text: This is not me. I wouldn't do something like that.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Maybe it's the old you? Or maybe sh..."
links.text: Maybe it's the old you? Or maybe she was just paranoid...

links.title: Empathy: "No, not even the old you. No you wo..."
links.text: No, not even the old you. No you would do that.

links.title: You: "What a coincidence..."
links.text: What a coincidence...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Is it? Can you be sure? What if you..."
links.text: Is it? Can you be sure? What if you are secretly being manipulated by La Puta Madre as you pursue this investigation. What if he wiped your memory on purpose?

links.title: Logic: "On purpose? That's pretty far-fetch..."
links.text: On purpose? That's pretty far-fetched.

links.title: You: "I'm okay with the idea."
links.text: I'm okay with the idea.

links.title: Inland Empire: "That's a good, pragmatic approach."
links.text: That's a good, pragmatic approach.

links.title: You: "Read the entry from March 12th."
links.text: Read the entry from March 12th.

links.title: Ruby's Journal: ""Been holed up here for three days..."
links.text: "Been holed up here for three days now. I'm used to being alone and all, but -- I don't know when I'll be able to leave, or if I'll be ratted out. They *will* rat me out, of course. I've made it a point to believe in the best in people (the boys, for example), but -- experience tells me..."

links.title: Ruby's Journal: ""Did M feel truly betrayed by me? I..."
links.text: "Did M feel truly betrayed by me? I was feeling threatened -- he'd have to know if he threatened people, they'd take measures to protect themselves. Even I know that. Economic measures first of all. Gotta make a living, right. I can still hear his voice in the receiver, taste the plastic..."

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "The entry ends abruptly."
links.text: The entry ends abruptly.

links.title: Authority: "The call was a courtesy. He must ha..."
links.text: The call was a courtesy. He must have held her in high regard to personally tell her he knew about her plan to run drugs for the competition.

links.title: Empathy: "That must have been one hell of a c..."
links.text: That must have been one hell of a conversation.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Were you *supposed* to find her, ev..."
links.text: Were you *supposed* to find her, even apart from the investigation, then? On M's request? No, you wouldn't do something like this. This must be a mistake.

links.title: Half Light: "You didn't follow through. You shou..."
links.text: You didn't follow through. You should have shot her in the head.

links.title: You: "Goddamn right, I should have."
links.text: Goddamn right, I should have.

links.title: Half Light: "Too late to do that now, *assassino..."
links.text: Too late to do that now, *assassino grande*! Better start looking over your shoulder now.

links.title: You: "Am I sure this is a mistake? Look a..."
links.text: Am I sure this is a mistake? Look at me.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Whatever you may *look* like, you d..."
links.text: Whatever you may *look* like, you don't *feel* like a hired assassin.

links.title: You: "This is a coincidence. I would neve..."
links.text: This is a coincidence. I would never kill people for a mob boss.

links.title: Inland Empire: "The thought steadies your nerves. T..."
links.text: The thought steadies your nerves. The journal stops shaking in your hand.

links.title: You: "Not now."
links.text: Not now.

links.title: You: ""No mention of La Puta Madre...""
links.text: "No mention of La Puta Madre..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What about this 'M'?" He points at..."
links.text: "What about this 'M'?" He points at the page you're staring at. "Could this be La Puta Madre? Here: March 9th and March 15th."

links.title: You: "What's the most recent entry? (Conc..."
links.text: What's the most recent entry? (Conclude with journal.)

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "The most recent entry is from today..."
links.text: The most recent entry is from today. It reads:

links.title: Ruby's Journal: ""Even when I leave here (if I leave..."
links.text:
"Even when I leave here (if I leave here alive) -- what's my next move?... Staging a lynching is a crime, even if I'm not accused of murder on top of that. Forever on the run? Not really my idea of the open road. 

Man, I was really looking forward to winning."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think she killed the merce..."
links.text: "I don't think she killed the mercenary." The lieutenant taps on the page. "It looks like she might have been... framed?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "This whole thing was a detour -- an..."
links.text: This whole thing was a detour -- and a fatal one, he thinks.

links.title: Volition: "Don't get emotional."
links.text: Don't get emotional.

links.title: You: ""So she died for nothing?""
links.text: "So she died for nothing?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""She was in plenty of trouble even..."
links.text: "She was in plenty of trouble even without the murder charge." He looks down. "Still, it's a nasty business."

links.title: You: ""She killed the merc, then turned t..."
links.text: "She killed the merc, then turned the gun on herself -- case closed. It's so tidy!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, it's dirty.""
links.text: "No, it's dirty."

links.title: Composure: "Kim's posture is unusually rigid --..."
links.text: Kim's posture is unusually rigid -- he's used to this sort of thing, but he's not particularly happy about being used to it.

links.title: You: ""Okay. What do you mean, framed?""
links.text: "Okay. What do you mean, framed?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""By the Hardie boys, by Klaasje, by..."
links.text: "By the Hardie boys, by Klaasje, by us."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like she might have been...."
links.text: "It looks like she might have been... framed?" The lieutenant taps on the page.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "That would be a first -- or a fourt..."
links.text: That would be a first -- or a fourth -- but who's counting, he thinks. Very rarely does anyone actually get framed.

links.title: You: ""If she didn't do it, then maybe it..."
links.text: "If she didn't do it, then maybe it's good that we didn't catch her?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wouldn't go so far as to say tha..."
links.text: "I wouldn't go so far as to say that -- we have other reasons to arrest her." He frowns.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Besides, I'm not sure her life as..."
links.text: "Besides, I'm not sure her life as a fugitive is going to be much better than with us."

links.title: You: ""Kim, am I really a La Puta Madre a..."
links.text: "Kim, am I really a La Puta Madre agent?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, I don't think you are." He loo..."
links.text: "No, I don't think you are." He looks you straight in the eye for a moment, then sighs. "Ask someone in your precinct if you want to be sure."

links.title: Drama: "He truly does not believe you are...."
links.text: He truly does not believe you are. Perhaps he shouldn't be so trusting...

links.title: Volition: "His trust is well placed. You aren'..."
links.text: His trust is well placed. You aren't. You can *feel* it.

links.title: You: ""Who *is* La Puta Madre?""
links.text: "Who *is* La Puta Madre?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The head of a major Jamrock gang s..."
links.text: "The head of a major Jamrock gang specializing in drug production and trafficking -- a very bad person."

links.title: Drama: "He's not 100% sure you're not indeb..."
links.text: He's not 100% sure you're not indebted to this very, very bad person.

links.title: You: ""Then who do you think killed Lely?..."
links.text: "Then who do you think killed Lely?" (Conclude.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Klaasje was the one who pointed th..."
links.text: "Klaasje was the one who pointed the finger at Ruby. Perhaps she was trying to steer us away from herself? Or..." He stops to think.

links.title: You: ""Seems plausible.""
links.text: "Seems plausible."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Either way, we need to keep an eye..."
links.text: "Either way, we need to keep an eye on her."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""One thing is for certain: We have..."
links.text: "One thing is for certain: We have business back in the Whirling-in-Rags. Questions to ask. We should get to it."

links.title: Half Light: "Something tells you you should be e..."
links.text: Something tells you you should be extra careful from now on.

links.title: You: ""I don't know...""
links.text: "I don't know..."

links.title: You: ""But no one heard the shot...""
links.text: "But no one heard the shot..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe she had an accomplice. Eithe..."
links.text: "Maybe she had an accomplice. Either way, we need to keep an eye on her."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Could have been Titus. Then again...."
links.text: "Could have been Titus. Then again..." He pauses to think.

links.title: You: ""But no one heard the shot...""
links.text: "But no one heard the shot..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe there's a Hardie boy we've y..."
links.text: "Maybe there's a Hardie boy we've yet to meet who acted as his accomplice? Either way, we need to keep an eye on him."

links.title: You: ""Seems plausible.""
links.text: "Seems plausible."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Either way, we need to keep an eye..."
links.text: "Either way, we need to keep an eye on him. Somewhere along the way, we might have been fed a lie or two..."

links.title: You: ""I don't know...""
links.text: "I don't know..."

links.title: You: ""T-man wouldn't fuck me over!""
links.text: "T-man wouldn't fuck me over!"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You should show all this to the lie..."
links.text: You should show all this to the lieutenant, see what he makes of it.

links.title: Ruby's Journal: ""Even when I leave here (if I leave..."
links.text:
"Even when I leave here (if I leave here alive) -- what's my next move?... Staging a lynching is a crime, even if I'm not accused of murder on top of that. Forever on the run? Not really my idea of the open road. 

Man, I was really looking forward to winning."

links.title: You: "(Look at the cover again.)"
links.text: (Look at the cover again.)

links.title: You: "Flip through the pages."
links.text: Flip through the pages.

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "It's a mix of logistical notes, dia..."
links.text: It's a mix of logistical notes, diagrams, and personal reflections, all dated.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We could learn a lot from this.""
links.text: "We could learn a lot from this."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's good she left in a hurry. We..."
links.text: "It's good she left in a hurry. We could learn a lot from this..."

links.title: You: "Put the journal away. [Leave.]"
links.text: Put the journal away. [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Ruby's Journal: "A thick journal. The cover is worn,..."
dialogueTree.text: A thick journal. The cover is worn, like someone used to carry it around in their back pocket.

links.title: You: "Examine the cover."
links.text: Examine the cover.

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "It's made of full-grain leather. Th..."
links.text: It's made of full-grain leather. The lower left corner of the back cover sports an embossed brand name: "SCHNELLER."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Schneller is a stationary brand fro..."
links.text: Schneller is a stationary brand from Gottwald beloved among architects and engineers.

links.title: Conceptualization: "She had good taste and must have ta..."
links.text: She had good taste and must have taken what she recorded here seriously.

links.title: Conceptualization: "She's got good taste and must have..."
links.text: She's got good taste and must have taken whatever she recorded here seriously.

links.title: Empathy: "This was important to her -- when i..."
links.text: This was important to her -- when it was still hers.

links.title: You: "Unwind the strap. (Move on.)"
links.text: Unwind the strap. (Move on.)

links.title: Ruby's Journal: "The journal falls open. About two t..."
links.text: The journal falls open. About two thirds of its ruled pages have been filled.
